intro: Philadelphus latifolius var. pendulifolius, commonly known as the weeping mock orange, is a deciduous shrub characterized by its graceful, arching branches. It features large, ovate, dark green leaves that are often tinged with red or purple in the autumn. The plant produces fragrant, white, clustered flowers in late spring to early summer, resembling those of the true orange blossom. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, fertile soil. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is often used in landscaping for its elegant, flowing appearance.
